summary:
KMD Brands Trading Update – Material Information:

  • Sales Performance (10 months to May 2025):
  • Group total sales: -0.5% YOY (Rip Curl +0.4%, Kathmandu -1.0%*, Oboz -4.1%).
  • Kathmandu: June (first 17 days) +13.2% YOY, reversing YTD to +0.3%; weather-affected winter categories (e.g., Insulation) but growth in Rainwear, Fleece.
  • Rip Curl: DTC sales grew YOY; wholesale improved but still below prior year.

  • Oboz: Wholesale trends improved; online sales above YTD despite US tariff uncertainty.

  • EBITDA Outlook: FY25 underlying EBITDA guidance $15M–$25M (impacted by ~$1M from US tariffs).

  • Net Debt: Expected $70M at 31 July 2025; inventory to be below FY24 levels.
  • Operational Updates:
  • Online sales +10.7% YTD; Kathmandu’s platform upgrade drove +26.1% growth post-launch (May).
  • Banking covenants amended; compliance expected by 31 July 2025.
  • Key Risks: US tariff volatility; weather-dependent demand (Kathmandu winter/Rip Curl summer).

Excludes non-material details (e.g., leadership quotes, brand background).

• Buy-back Type: On-market
  • Total Securities Bought Back (Previous Day): 37,570 HMY shares
  • Total Consideration Paid (Previous Day): AUD 19,524.59
  • Price Range (Previous Day): AUD 0.51 – AUD 0.525
  • Maximum Buy-back Allowance: Up to 5% of issued shares (~5.1 million shares)
  • Buy-back Period: 13/5/2025 to 29/4/2026
  • Broker: Ord Minnett Limited
  • No Shareholder Approval Required

No material deviations or new filings identified.

• Substantial holding change disclosure: Steven Newman and NMC Investment Trust reduced holdings in EROAD Limited (NZX: ERD).
  • Steven Newman:
    • Current holding: 5.347% (10,020,952 shares).
    • Previous holding: 7.290% (13,474,111 shares).
  • NMC Investment Trust:
    • Current holding: 5.257% (9,853,024 shares).
    • Previous holding: 7.195% (13,297,083 shares).
  • Key transaction:
  • 13 June 2025: NMC Trust sold 2,000,000 shares (~1.07% stake) on-market for A$2.82m (NZ$3.03m).
  • Feb 2024–May 2025: NMC Trust sold 1,444,059 shares (0.771%) for A$1.35m (NZ$1.45m).

Material impact: Combined stake reduced from ~14.485% to ~10.604%, signalling potential loss of influence or exit intent. Omit non-material personal holdings (<0.1%).

• Announcement Type: Strategic Energy Reserve Agreement
  • Key Points:
  • Non-binding term sheet signed with Mercury, Meridian, and Contact to establish a strategic energy reserve centered on Huntly Power Station to address national energy security.
  • Rankine Units (previously slated for retirement) to remain operational until at least 2035, supporting grid stability amid renewable energy transition.
  • Proposal includes 10-year framework (to 2035), potential biomass fuel transition, and residual capacity offered via Huntly Firming Options.
  • Target operational start: 1 January 2026; final commitment required by early November 2025.

Omitted non-material details: Media/IR contacts, company background.
